_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The five reasons why someone asks a ques: Someone asks a question of another from stupidity and folly.
They ask from wicked desires, being naturally full of desires.
They ask in order to disparage.
They ask with the thought, ‘If they correctly answer the question I ask it’s good. If not, I’ll correctly answer it for them.’
